senses.sense_definition: Relating to, resembling, or containing mylonite, a fine-grained metamorphic rock formed by the crushing and grinding of rocks along a fault line.

examples.text: The geologist examined the <w>mylonitic</w> texture of the sample to understand the history of the fault zone.
Intense pressure deep underground created a <w>mylonitic</w> zone where the rock structure was completely altered.
